benchmark_details.name: Geospatial foundation models for image analysis: evaluating and enhancing NASA-IBM Prithvi’s domain adaptability
benchmark_details.overview: This paper evaluates the effectiveness of NASA-IBM's foundation model Prithvi in its ability for multiple downstream tasks for remote sensing image analysis. Four benchmark datasets containing environmental and land use features and covering diverse geographical regions are selected in the analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of NASA-IBM's foundation model Prithvi and its applicability in remote sensing image analysis tasks.

data.source: Four benchmark datasets including Mars crater, Earth’s natural features, Ice-wedge polygons, and EuroCrops.
data.annotation: Annotated by domain experts with instance-level bounding boxes.

methodology.calculation: Computed mAP scores for model performance across multiple IoU thresholds.
methodology.interpretation: Higher mAP scores indicate better model performance in object detection and segmentation tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using four distinct remote sensing datasets.
